medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed mild diffuse myalgias in the evening before admission. He awoke with diffuse muscle cramps and intense pain (rated 10/10) in his legs the following morning, feeling unsteady and having difficulty walking. Muscle pain persisted with weakness and numbness in his legs, preventing him from rising again. He had experienced similar but less severe pain intermittently for the past month, primarily in the upper thighs after rest, occurring several times a week, mostly at night and resolving spontaneously.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had gynecomastia diagnosed approximately 3 months ago, androgenetic alopecia, seborrheic dermatitis, and a history of tuberculosis treatment 17 years earlier. He experienced weight loss of 3.2 kg in the previous month and had a respiratory infection 6 weeks before admission that improved after azithromycin.
medical_history.family_history: Family history includes a mother with diabetes mellitus, hypercholesterolemia, and bladder cancer; a father with hypertension; a cousin and niece with thyroid disease. No history of autoimmune disease was reported.
medical_history.social_history: The patient lives with his brother, works in a restaurant, is single, has a history of infrequent alcohol consumption, does not smoke or use illicit drugs, and consumed a high carbohydrate diet, eating 10 slices of pizza the night before admission. He was born in Colombia and had lived in the U.S. for about 17 years, visiting Colombia 6 months before.
